Parameters: String: The error or warning message.
SourceLocator: The locator object for the error or warning.
TransformerException(java.lang.String,ja.Description: Create a new TransformerException from a message and a Locator. This constructor is especially useful when an application is creating its own exception from within a DocumentHandler callback.

Parameters: String: The error or warning message, or null to use the message from the embedded exception.
TransformerException(java.lang.String,ja.Description: Wrap an existing exception in a TransformerException. This is used for throwing processor exceptions before the processing has started.

Returns: A String representing the error message with location information appended.
getMessageAndLocation().Description: Get the error message with location information appended.

Returns: A SourceLocator object, or null if none was specified.
getLocator().Description: Method getLocator retrieves an instance of a SourceLocator object that specifies where an error occurred.

Returns: a reference to this Throwable instance.
Parameters: Throwable: the cause (which is saved for later retrieval by the @B_javax#xml#transform#TransformerException#getCause_E@ method). (A null value is permitted, and indicates that the cause is nonexistent or unknown.)
Throws: if cause is this throwable. (A throwable cannot be its own cause.)

if this throwable was created with @B_javax#xml#transform#TransformerException#TransformerException_E@ or @B_javax#xml#transform#TransformerException#TransformerException_E@, or this method has already been called on this throwable.
initCause(java.lang.Throwable).Description: Initializes the This method can be called at most once. It is generally called from within the constructor, or immediately after creating the throwable. If this throwable was created with @B_javax#xml#transform#TransformerException#TransformerException_E@ or @B_javax#xml#transform#TransformerException#TransformerException_E@, this method cannot be called even once.

Parameters: PrintWriter: The writer where the dump will be sent to.
printStackTrace(java.io.PrintWriter).Description: Print the the trace of methods from where the error originated. This will trace all nested exception objects, as well as this object.

Parameters: String: The error or warning message.
SourceLocator: A SourceLocator object, or null to clear the location.
setLocator(javax.xml.transform.SourceLoc.Description: Method setLocator sets an instance of a SourceLocator object that specifies where an error occurred.

printStackTrace().Description: Print the the trace of methods from where the error originated. This will trace all nested exception objects, as well as this object.

Returns: the cause of this throwable or null if the cause is nonexistent or unknown.
getCause().Description: Returns the cause of this throwable or null if the cause is nonexistent or unknown. (The cause is the throwable that caused this throwable to get thrown.)

Parameters: Throwable: The exception to be wrapped.
TransformerException(java.lang.Throwable.Description: Create a new TransformerException wrapping an existing exception.

Returns: A string with location info, or null if there is no location information.
getLocationAsString().Description: Get the location information as a string.

getException().Description: This method retrieves an exception that this exception wraps.

Parameters: String: The error or warning message, or null to use the message from the embedded exception.
SourceLocator: The locator object for the error or warning.

ClassDesc: This class specifies an exceptional condition that occurred during the transformation process.
